STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 14, 2023
Natasha Doan-Motsinger
Our House- Mosaic
111 S. Wallace Blvd,
Ypsilanti, MI, 48197-4644
Re: License #: CB810406448
Dear Ms. Doan-Motsinger:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
3/14/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather A Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the
following information before employment may occur:
(c) Work history.
Two of seven employee files did not have documentation of work history on file.
2

CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the
following information before employment may occur:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
Seven of seven employee files did not have documentation to show that
references were contacted.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member’s
performance within a probationary period or not later
than 6 months after the staff member assumes his or
her current responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a
written evaluation shall be conducted each year.
One of three employee files did not have an annual performance evaluation
completed in 2022.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(b) A copy of the job description for the staff
member’s current position.
Four of seven employee files did not have a copy of their job description in the
file.
3

CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living contract
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the
youth and the social service worker. The contract shall
be reviewed and updated at least once every 90
calendar days and a copy provided to the youth.
One of three IL youth files was missing a quarterly updated IL contract.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
1/21/2022 Renewal, CAP Approved 1/25/2022
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living
services for a youth, the agency shall document all of
the following information in the case record within 30
calendar days of termination of its services: (a-d).
Two of two closed IL files did not have the documentation required by this rule.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED (Previously cited as FOM 722-08e)
1/21/2022 Renewal, CAP Approved 1/25/2022
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Youth file photo must be a complete photo of their face without a mask.
• Employee performance evaluations should be signed by the employee and
evaluator.
• When an employee changes from one job position to another, within their
probationary period, a performance evaluation should be completed prior to
changing positions.
• HR files must differentiate the employee "hire date" from the "start date", to
ensure clear documentation that required clearances were completed prior to the
staff interacting with youth or having access to confidential case information.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
4

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency had one CAP during this review period, as a result of the January
2022 renewal inspection. The agency reported successful implementation and
compliance in the areas addressed in the CAP. This renewal review found the
agency has shown significant compliance in most areas. However, there were
two repeat violations identified regarding updated IL contracts and closing
documentation. The agency will develop a new CAP to address this item.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment (CAA) was reviewed. The agency
reported successful implementation of their CAP and some additional changes,
unrelated to the CAP, which benefited the program over the past year. The CAA
addressed some of the current violations, with changes in tracking and utilizing
checklists to ensure items are completed. These strategies will be included in
the new CAP developed for the 2023 interim evaluation. In addition, the CAA
identified an issue with some DHHS cases that were not assigned correctly in
MISACWIS, which caused incorrect information in the system and in the
agency's key performance indicators. However, they continue to work with the
DHHS monitor to address this area.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were found.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed during this review. Both staff report they feel there
were positive improvements over the past year to address concerns with IL youth
that struggled in the program. Some staff changes were made, in addition to
partnering with community services. Overall, staff did not have any concerns
about the agency or suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to work out of the same building. However, it has
expanded the available office space. The office was found to be clean and
sufficient for required duties, with adequate secured storage.
5

VII. ANALYST FINDINGS
This is a non-contracted, IL only program. Therefore, an analyst review was not
required.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
_______________March 14, 2023_________________________
Heather A Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
March 14, 2023
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
